meanings.definition: The quality or state of being imputable.
meanings.sent1: Her imputability for the mistake was clear to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The imputability of the crime to the suspect was undeniable.
meanings.sent3: His imputability for eating all the cookies was met with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The imputability of success to hard work is a common belief.
meanings.sent5: The imputability of the painting to the artist was evident in every brushstroke.

meanings.definition: The attribution of responsibility or blame to a particular person or group.
meanings.sent1: The imputability of the accident to the driver was questioned.
meanings.sent2: In court, the imputability of the crime was a key point of discussion.
meanings.sent3: The imputability of the missing cake fell on the family dog.
meanings.sent4: The imputability of the team's failure was placed on the coach.
meanings.sent5: The imputability of the decision to the committee was unanimous.
